channel.title: math.CT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Concentration structures on categories and horizontal categorification
item.description: arXiv:2510.07553v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce a theory for encoding and manipulating algebraic data on categories via $\textit{concentration structures}$, which are equivalence relations on morphisms that satisfy certain axioms. For any category with a concentration structure we can functorially construct a $\textit{concentration monoid}$, which can be used to give a precise definition of horizontal categorification and decategorification. Moreover, by studying concentration structures on fundamental groupoids, we show that every group arises as the concentration monoid of a trivial category, up to category equivalence.
item.dc:creator: Yangxiao Luo, Shunyu Wan

item.title: Morita Equivalence for Quantales
item.description: arXiv:2510.07565v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study Morita equivalence in the context of quantales with identity, in the wake of Katsov and Nam's analogous work on semirings. Among a number of other results, we prove a characterization of Morita equivalence and an Eilenberg-Watts-type Theorem for quantales.
item.dc:creator: Moacyr Rodrigues, Ciro Russo

item.title: TASI Lectures On Topological Field Theories And Differential Cohomology
item.description: arXiv:2510.07408v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: These are lecture notes expanding upon a set of lectures given by G.M. at the TASI 2023 School. Part I is an introduction to topological field theory, including extended topological field theory. Part II is an introduction to generalized Abelian gauge theories and their relation to differential cohomology.
item.dc:creator: Gregory W. Moore, Vivek Saxena

item.title: Homotopy type theory as a language for diagrams of $\infty$-logoses
item.description: arXiv:2212.02444v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We show that certain diagrams of $\infty$-logoses are reconstructed in homotopy type theory extended with some lex, accessible modalities, which enables us to use plain homotopy type theory to reason about not only a single $\infty$-logos but also a diagram of $\infty$-logoses. This also provides a higher dimensional version of Sterling's synthetic Tait computability -- a type theory for higher dimensional logical relations.
item.dc:creator: Taichi Uemura
